issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We should not log stack traces for expected conditions such as access denied:

{code}
Wed May 25 15:08:34 2016 DEBUG [PolicyEngineImpl:ObjectStorageGateway.96] Request is rejected by authorization check, due to decision DEFAULT
Wed May 25 15:08:34 2016 DEBUG [Permissions:ObjectStorageGateway.96] Denied resource access to s3:object:c5ac2f6b-bucket1/bar for com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.UserPrincipalImpl@3fb551c6: Access to the resource is denied
Wed May 25 15:08:34 2016  WARN [ObjectStorageGateway:ObjectStorageGateway.96] CorrelationId: 950b59d3-f188-4851-8e7b-d3026369eb26 Responding to client with:

fields.summary: OSG should not log stack traces for access denied

comments.body: Let's only do this if it is easy. Otherwise push off to next release.

Found stack traces for ACL checks in cloud-tracking.log, should those be suppressed as well?

{noformat}
2016-06-07 17:24:56 DEBUG DatabaseAuthProvider     | [8816aff4-2d80] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such user
2016-06-07 17:24:56 DEBUG DatabaseAuthProvider     | [8816aff4-2d80] Error occurred looking for account by canonical ID 5c332e32e4d5583348372818113e354953441833281461501b262c4e23533c52 with exception com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: N
o such user | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:488) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.lookupAccountByCanonicalId(Accounts.java:140) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euar
e.persist.entities.AccountEntity.genCanonicalId(AccountEntity.java:158) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.entities.AccountEntity.populateCanonicalId(AccountEntity.java:135) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.entities.AccountEntity.ge
nerateOnCommit(AccountEntity.java:130) | com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities.persist(Entities.java:870) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persist.DatabaseAuthProvider.doAddAccount(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:213) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.persis
t.DatabaseAuthProvider.addAccount(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:174) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Accounts.addAccount(Accounts.java:184) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Privileged.createAccount(Privileged.java:125) | com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.Eu
areService.createAccount(EuareService.java:133) |
2016-06-07 17:24:57 DEBUG OsgAuthorizationHandler  | [1fae85d4-34e3] Request is rejected by ACL checks due to account ownership requirements
2016-06-07 17:24:57  WARN ObjectStorageGateway     | [1fae85d4-34e3] CorrelationId: 1fae85d4-34e3-41dd-bae1-a5bcc6fbe178 Responding to client with:
com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.exceptions.s3.AccessDeniedException: Access Denied
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.ObjectStorageGateway.getObjectEntityAndCheckPermissions(ObjectStorageGateway.java:2130)

{noformat}

We may need to also look at the following methods for access denied stack trace logging:

* createBucket
* deleteObject
* deleteVersion

We could restrict the current fix to being specific to PUT (the originally reported issue) and open a new issue for further fixes.
[~shaon], original issue was about put operation. I think we should not log general access denied errors. The one that you've posted is for getObject.
I've supressed few more cases. There is a chance I've still missed some. Let's open a separate bugs for them if found.

Verified.

*Installed Packages*

Arch        : x86_64
